section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW iDrive is the vehicle’s display and operating concept and includes a wide range of functions.

overview.overview-text: Observe when operating systems and devices

warning.paragraph: Operating the integrated information systems and communication devices while driving can distract from surrounding traffic. It is possible to lose control of the vehicle. There is a risk of accident. Only use the systems or devices when the traffic situation allows. As warranted, stop and use the systems and devices while the vehicle is stationary.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The main menu is divided into different areas.

section.title: Menu
section.paragraph: "MENU": Access to apps and vehicle functions. A filter can be selected. The last selected filter is stored. If necessary, change the filter to see the apps you want.

item.paragraph: "All apps": All apps and functions are displayed.
"Infotain­ment apps": Only infotainment apps are displayed.
"Vehicle apps": Only vehicle adjustment functions are displayed.

section.title: Media
section.paragraph: "MEDIA": Access to entertainment system functions, e.g., radio stations, or connection with external devices.

section.title: Telephone
section.paragraph: "TEL": Access to telephone and message function as well as connection and management of mobile devices such as smartphones.

section.title: Navigation
section.paragraph: "NAV": Access to navigation system, destination entry, and traffic bulletins. Configurable map views and other functions, such as points of interest.

section.title: Apple CarPlay©
section.paragraph: "Apple CarPlay": Depending on national-market version with related function: access to Apple CarPlay. Apple CarPlay enables the secure use of certain functions of a compatible Apple iPhone via iDrive.

section.title: Android Auto©
section.paragraph: "Android Auto": Depending on national-market version with related function: access to Android Auto. Android Auto enables the secure use of certain functions of a compatible Android smartphone via iDrive.

section.title: Widgets
section.paragraph: Widgets show real-time information and dynamic content such as the navigation map. The widgets also serve as buttons and allow jumping to the relevant menu.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The BMW Curved Display is a single-screen display in the vehicle that is curved towards the driver. The BMW Curved Display comprises the instrument cluster on the driver’s side and the Control Display on the center console.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Follow instructions for cleaning the BMW Curved Display in the Care chapter.

overview.overview-text: Do not place objects in front of the Control Display

warning.paragraph: Objects in the area in the front of the Control Display can slip and damage the Control Display. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not place objects in the area in front of the Control Display.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The BMW Intelligent Personal Assistant is a personal assistant that enables natural voice operation of various vehicle functions. The Personal Assistant simplifies the operation of the vehicle with the automation of processes and habits.

item.paragraph: BMW Intelligent Personal Assistant is available depending on national-market version.
The system includes special microphones on the driver side and the front passenger side.

section.title: Personal activation word
section.paragraph: In addition to the preset activation word, a personal activation word can be set up with an active BMW ID or a driver profile. The personal activation word can also be changed or deleted.
The activation word should consist of multiple syllables to ensure good recognition. An addition such as ›Hello‹ is not necessary.

section.title: Owner's Manual via voice operation
section.paragraph: You can ask simple questions about vehicle functions and the operation of the vehicle.

The voice activation system and the feedback it provides do not replace the printed or Integrated Owner's Manual. The function is available depending on the national-market version. The speech recognition and quality of the feedback may vary.

section.paragraph: The voice of the Personal Assistant can be adjusted.

section.title: Setting the response length
section.paragraph: You can set the Personal Assistant to use standard dialog or a short version. In case of the short version, the announcements by the Personal Assistant are played back in an abbreviated version.

section.title: Speaking during voice output
section.paragraph: It is possible to answer during inquiries of the Personal Assistant. The function can be disabled if requests are often canceled unintentionally, for instance due to background noise or conversations in the vehicle.

section.title: Online speech processing
section.paragraph: Online speech processing improves the quality of the speech recognition and search results for points of interest. To use the functions, data is transmitted to a service provider via an encrypted connection and stored locally there. An active ConnectedDrive contract is required for online voice processing. ConnectedDrive is available depending on the national-market version.

section.title: Voice control from third-party providers
section.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment, third-party voice control can be enabled by pressing and holding the microphone button on the steering wheel.

section.title: Adjusting the volume
section.paragraph: Turn the volume button during the voice guidance until the desired volume is set.
The volume remains constant even if the volume of other audio sources is changed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Personal Assistant can automate routines, for instance the automatic opening of windows in the same place. Rules are created for this purpose, which can be activated and deactivated at any time.

item.paragraph: The Personal Assistant provides information about vehicle functions that may not be installed in the vehicle.
This also applies to safety-related functions and systems.
Certain noises can be detected and may lead to problems. Keep the doors and windows closed.
Noises from the front passenger or occupants can impair the system. Avoid making other noise in the vehicle while speaking.
Major language dialects can cause problems with the speech recognition feature.
A poor data connection influences the response time of the Personal Assistant and the Search.
